By studying on NSUL-1 adsorption isotherms and adsorption dynamics, results described that adsorption process of oilfield injection water treated by NSUL-1 coincided with the Freundlich equation, and the adsorption process followed pseudo-first-order dynamics adsorption model, namely the adsorption process was a physical adsorption and the reaction rate was proportional to the concentration of crude oil in wastewater.

keywords.kw: New absorbent NSUL-1, oilfield injection water, adsorption, oil removal rate, absorption characteristics

article_rec.title: Research on Wireless Remote Control for Coal Mine Detection Robot

abstract.par: In order to satisfy the requirement of Coal Mine Detection Robot’s control system and wireless remote control, embedded motion control system is studied and designed. According to underground environmental demands of the coal mine, the wireless communication method and optimum transmission frequency is analyzed and selected, and this system can display timely the remote image around the mobile robot and implement wireless control of such motions of robot as moving forward, backward, turning left, turning right and tipping over the front arm.

keywords.kw: Coal Mine Detection Robot, Motion Control, Remote Control, Communication Method

article_rec.title: Reserch on Multilevel Sections Synchronous Expanding and Contracting Hydraulics Cylinder

abstract.par: Multi level sections synchronous expanding and contracting hydraulics cylinder is a new type multilevel sections hydraulics cylinder, it has many special properties. Comparing with other general type multilevel sections hydraulics cylinder, it could achieve the synchronous actions of the multilevel sections hydraulics cylinder. Therefore, its transmission rate is high. Also it can maintain a steady speed when it works. It has a little impact and libration and works steadily. With accurately using, it could improve the properties of hydraulic system and efficacy of hydraulic equipment, and its value should be popularized. The basal structure and the principle of four sections synchronous expanding and contracting hydraulics cylinder are detailedly discussed in the article. The primary parameters about hydraulics cylinder, such as pressure and speed etc, are analyzed. The author also concludes the primary properties of the four sections synchronous expanding and contracting hydraulics cylinder in this article, and introduces a new type of multilevel sections synchronous expanding and contracting hydraulics cylinder.

keywords.kw: multilevel sections synchronous expanding and contracting hydraulics cylinde, working principle, primary parameters, characteristics

article_rec.title: Resin Vacuum Casting System for LED Screen

abstract.par: This paper mainly describes the resin vacuum casting system for LED screen which uses thin film degassing technology and meter mix technology. Thin film degassing technology is currently the most effective method. In this paper, we describe in detail its working model. And meter mix dispensing technology integrates metering pump and mixing pump. It mixes materials according to the demand. Therefore, the mixture is fresh always and does not cure in mixer. At the same time, there is no waiting time. It has excellent infiltration, thus facilitating to automatic operation. Experimental results show that this system effectively solve the bubble phenomenon and heterogeneous mixture.

keywords.kw: resin casting, thin film degassing technology, static mixer, meter mix dispensing

article_rec.title: Reverse Triple I Methods Based on Parametric-Implication Operators

abstract.par: With parametric-implication operators of Hα system given by Professor Wang, formulas of reverse triple I methods based on FMP and FMT problems are given. And furthermore, the problem is generalized, formulas of the α-Triple I FMP and α-Triple I FMT are obtained respectively.

keywords.kw: fuzzy reasoning, implication operator, triple I method, reverse triple I method

article_rec.title: Roles of Tropical Indian-Pacific Oceans SSTs in the Interdecadal Variability of East Asian Summer Monsoon
article_rec.subtitle: A Modeling Study

abstract.par: This study investigates the roles of tropical Indian-Pacific oceans SSTs in the interdecadal variability of East Asian Summer Monsoon (EASM) during the second half of the twentieth century based on simulations from an atmospheric general circulation model, NCAR CAM3 (Community Atmospheric Model). These simulations are conducted by the observed 1950-2000 monthly SSTs in the tropical Indian-Pacific oceans, tropical Indian Ocean and tropical Pacific, independently. Results show that CAM3 is able to simulate the observed interdecadal weakening of EASM occurred in the mid-late 1970s when SSTs in tropical Indian-Pacific Oceans and tropical Pacific SSTs are determined, but to simulate the interdecadal strengthening of EASM when SSTs in the tropical Indian Ocean are determined. These results indicate that SST anomaly in the tropical Pacific plays a central role in the interdecadal weakening of EASM occurred in the mid-late of 1970s, while SST anomaly in the tropical Indian Ocean plays a converse role in it. As a background, the interdecadal variation of tropical Pacific SSTs has an important effect upon the interdecadal weakening of EASM.

keywords.kw: East Asian summer monsoon, interdecadal variability, sea surface temperature, tropical Indian Ocean, tropical Pacific, numerical simulation

article_rec.title: RTDS Based Maximal Power Point Tracking Simulation for Permanent Magnet Synchronous Generator

abstract.par: In the control of the wind generation, the maximal power point tracking (MPPT) control plays important role in the efficiency. This paper presents the simulation results of the MPPT control with RTDS-based PMSG model. At first, it analyzes the vector-control scheme for the MTTP, which results in independent control of active and reactive power of the generator. And then, it develops the MPPT controller implemented on the rectifier and inverter based on PI control strategic. Furthermore, it builds the PMSG model based on the RTDS with the corresponding technology. And the simulation result with the proposed model verified the control strategy.

keywords.kw: Wind energy, PMSG, Stator flux-oriented, Maximal power point tracking

article_rec.title: Selective Purchasing Optimization of Raw Materials for Refined Copper Strip by BFO Algorithm

abstract.par: Aiming at improving the efficiency and scientificity of raw materials purchasing for refined copper strip producing, a multi-objective optimization model is established, the model is transformed by introducing some constraints into the objective function. For the raw material purchasing problem of refined copper strip, the encoding system of BFO algorithm is designed, and the tumble direction in conventional BFO algorithm is adapted so as to ensure bacteria swim feasible location each time. Thereby, the detail implement steps of BFO algorithm are designed. By the practical instance application of raw material purchasing problem of refined copper strip, the validity of above optimization model and BFO algorithm for the complex optimization model such as raw material purchasing problem of refined copper strip is validates.

keywords.kw: refined copper strip, raw material, selective purchasing, bacteria foraging optimization algorithm

article_rec.title: Separation and Purification of Methane from coal-Bed Methane via the Hydrate Technology

abstract.par: The separation of methane from coal-bed methane (CBM) via hydrate process using tetrahydrofuran (THF) + sodium dodecyl sulfate (SDS) as additives was investigated in this work. The effect of additives, the concentration of the additives and hydrate memory effect on the hydrate-based separation process were examined at various concentrations of THF + SDS solutions. The results indicate that THF + SDS solutions decrease the formation pressure of methane remarkably and show that the methane concentration in CBM can be enhanced effectively with the system of THF (1.0 mol%) + SDS (500 ppm) in the moderate condition. The concentration of CH4 can be increased by about 20% for the two feed gases (20% and 50% CH4/N2). It indicates the CBM with low methane can be improved to the one which can be used directly by several steps of the hydrate-based separation technology.

keywords.kw: CBM, hydrate, separation, THF, SDS

article_rec.title: Simulation Analysis of DSPACE-Based Multidisciplinary Electric Power Steering System

abstract.par: The Electric power steering (EPS) is a typical multidisciplinary system. Its development cycle is long, and the development process is complicated. The uncertain change of the road and car driving conditions makes the EPS system strong in the nonlinearity and uncertainty, and the development more difficult. To meet the rapid verification and performance testing for the EPS system, this paper designs the controller using the robust H algorithm of the mixed sensitivity, tests and analyzes comprehensively the EPS system using the loop simulation based on dSPACE. The results show that the H∞ algorithm of the mixed sensitivity makes the EPS system have good robustness, the loop simulation technology can effectively shorten and simplify the development process.

keywords.kw: electric power steering, the loop simulation, H8 control, dSPACE, multidisciplinary

article_rec.title: Simulation Analysis on Mechanical Properties for Corroded Deformed Steel Bar

abstract.par: Based on the pitting corrosion characteristics of corroded deformed steel bars embedded in concrete structures in chloride environment, the Finite Element fine Model is established by the ANSYS FE software, and nonlinear analysis was conducted for the influence of corrosion pit on the resistance properties of steel bars. Results show that the effect of pit location is apparent on the mechanical properties of deformed steel bars. The influence of the corrosion pit located at the transverse rib is a little, the second at the longitudinal rib, the most serious at the base circle. The effect of the width and depth for the corrosion pits at the base circle is studied on the relation curves of force and deformation for steel bars, and it is established for the relational expression of the critical width and depth at the disappearance of the yield step on the curves.

keywords.kw: Corrosion, Deformed Steel Bar, Simulation Analysis

article_rec.title: Simulation and Calculation of Hydrodynamic Forces of Components of Deep Sea Mining System

abstract.par: For the purpose of simulation of the deployment and retrieval of deep sea mining system, two methods for assessing the added mass of components of deep sea mining system are mainly proposed in this work. The first method is referred to as the Hess-Smith method which is based on surface panel method and potential theory, the surface of the moving object is discretized to lots of panels to approximate the object surface, and dipole or the combination of source and dipole are attached on each panel so as to determine velocity potential, then obtain added mass. The second method is referred to here as Fluent method which is a constant acceleration method based on the computational fluid dynamics (CFD) software Fluent. The added mass coefficient of components of mining system which are acquired from the two methods are approximately equal, both are applicable for infinite flow field, while for the condition of free surface, including water entry, mining tool touching down the seafloor, the Fluent method is more suitable.

keywords.kw: Added mass, Hess-Smith method, Fluent, CFD, deep-sea mining system

article_rec.title: Simulation Investigation on the Multiple Injections of Two-Actuator Controlled Fuel Injection System

abstract.par: The multiple injection characteristics of two-actuator controlled fuel injection system(two-actuator system) were investigated in this paper, which was established by the Electronic Unit Pump and Common Rail injector to realize the way to independently control the pumping and injection processes. The two-actuator system simulation model was validated and the results indicated consistency between the calculative and the experimental one. Consequently, the model is capable of predicting the characteristics of two-actuator system and plays an extension and complementarity role for experiments, The simulation results of multiple injections illustrated that two-actuator system enables to generate different nozzle opening pressure efficiently and produce a very flexible control of injection rate through changing control parameters of both SCV and NCV.

keywords.kw: Two-Actuator Controlled Fuel Injection System, Multiple Injection Characteristics, Simulation Investigation

article_rec.title: Simulation Modeling of Transient Temperatures and Stresses Fields During Quenching 7075 Aluminum Cone-Shaped Shells

abstract.par: The technological and economical pressures in manufacturing industry require an optimization of existing production processes. For this purpose, Thermal elastic-plastic constitutive equations are established to gain insight into the quenching operation of a production system. The finite element model is established to model transient 3-D temperature ad stress fields during quenching of the cone-shaped shells. The X-ray diffraction method is applied to measure the residual stresses of cone-shaped shell. And the measured residual stresses of quenched cone-shaped shell show a good agreement with those simulated by FEM. The example of FEM application in this paper offers theoretical basis and technological parameters for practical production, and makes it possible to optimize the process parameters of heat treatment of cone-shaped shells to control quality in the weapons production.

keywords.kw: Simulation, modeling, quenching process, Optimization, Finite element method

article_rec.title: Simulation of APDL-Based Super-High Pressure Compressor Pipeline System Vibration Control

abstract.par: In order to solve the problem that super-high pressure compressor pipeline system had serious vibration and noise pollution, finite element method was used in this paper to have system vibration analysis and a vibration control program was designed by changing system inflexibility. On the other hand, in order to improve the efficiency of simulation modeling, the ANSYS parametric design language（APDL）was used to build pipeline system vibration analysis models which can be revised by test data and recover vibration field. After the implementation of the program, test data showed that the vibration displacement drop greatly, all displacement values meet compressor vibration norms. The result proved that the APDL-based finite element analysis approach was an effective way to have super-high pressure compressor pipeline system vibration control, which solved hand-modeling inefficiency issues and improved the efficiency of the simulation modeling.

keywords.kw: APDL, Super-high pressure compressor, Vibration control, Simulation

article_rec.title: Simulation of Hydrogen Production from Biomass Catalytic Gasification

abstract.par: In this study, biomass catalytic gasification process for producing H2-rich gas was presented. The process consists of mainly two fluidized beds—a gasifier and a CaO regenerator. The objective of this research is to develop a computer model of biomass catalytic gasification. A model was developed using Aspen Plus software. The model predicted gas composition and hydrogen yield in good agreement with experimental data. In the case of CaCO3 catalysis, the effects of operating parameters, including gasification temperature, steam to biomass ratio and CaCO3 addition on product gas composition, and hydrogen yield were analyzed. The results showed the use of CaCO3 has the potential to enhance the hydrogen content, and the suitable gasification temperature is at 650-700 ℃ in this catalytic reaction. Furthermore, the hydrogen yield can reach 77.48g/kg biomass, and the highest hydrogen concentration can reach more than 70% (mol) at the optimal conditions.

keywords.kw: biomass gasification, hydrogen production, Aspen Plus

article_rec.title: Simulation of Inclusions Motion and Removal in RH Refining

abstract.par: Steady, three-dimensional velocity fields inside the RH are obtained, then be used to predict the removal of inclusions from molten steel with the help of Fluent. Inclusion transport in RH and the influence of inclusion diameter, density and lifting gas flow rate on inclusion removal rate are discussed. It is found that inclusion removal rate varies greatly with size. Inclusions lager than 50μm are removed easier. Decreasing density causes a slight increase in the removal time of inclusions. The inclusion is easier to be removed when the density is less than 3,500 kg/m3. The best lifting gas flow rate for inclusion removal is 1200NL/min.

keywords.kw: Simulation, RH, inclusion, motion, removal

article_rec.title: Simulation of Two Side Direction Burr Formation

abstract.par: Two side direction burrs is an important factor of influence to edge quality and performance of precision parts. A finite element model was developed for simulation of two side direction burr formation process. Based on strain distribution, a two side burr formation mechanism was proposed. Strain of Cutting lay material near the side face in two side direction of work piece is determinant factor of two side direction burr. Burr form and burr size of simulation are close to that’s of experiment. Finite element model generated here provided a numerical analysis method to solve the prediction of burr formation and physical insight into the fundamental burr formation mechanism.

keywords.kw: Two Side Direction Burr, Finite Element Model, Chip, Side Flow

article_rec.title: Simulation on Compound Action Between Deep Fault and Karst Collapse Column Take GuQiao Coal Mine as an Example

abstract.par: In deep mining area, karst and fault developed, water inrush characteristic is the result of compound action between fault and karst collapse column, Discontinuous Deformation Analysis software (DDA) was used to simulate the compound action between fault and karst collapse column, The results showed that, on the one hand, the fault slip direction and scope was controlled by the column geometry form, on the other hand, the growth of fault will speed up the formation of collapse column.

keywords.kw: water inrush, fault, karst collapse column

article_rec.title: Simulation on Pore Size Distribution of Calcined Product from Calcium-Based Sorbents

abstract.par: In this paper, on the theoretical basis of pore volume distribution function which was measurable in laboratory, the novel distribution model concerning about some parameters including total pore specific surface area and total pore specific volume was given to successfully simulate pore volume, surface area and length, and that a subsequent the calculating result of pore volume distribution was compared with experimental result. It was found that for a full characterization of pore size distribution of calcium-based sorbents, it was feasible to employ this distribution model.

keywords.kw: Calcium-based sorbents, pore size distribution, calcination, simulation

article_rec.title: Speed Control System Based on Improved Fuzzy-PID Hybrid Control for Direct Current Motor

abstract.par: This paper describes a new hybrid speed regulating method based on improved Fuzzy-PID, which is used in the speed loop for speed and current closed loop control direct current (DC) motor control system. The specific way of the hybrid method depends on the value of the error between reference speed and actual speed when it is bigger than threshold value, the fuzzy control is used, when it reduces to below the threshold value, the PID adjustment is used. The simulation research on the new hybrid speed regulating system of DC motor is carried out. The results of simulation show that the system based on improved fuzzy-PID hybrid control has better dynamic and static performance than the system based on conventional fuzzy-PID hybrid control. A new hybrid speed control system of DJ23 DC motor of DDSZ-1 electrical machinery and electrical technology test installation is designed. The system based on this new hybrid speed regulating method has a control unit of the single-chip Atmega128. Controlling the PWM duty cycle is equivalent to controlling the motor armature voltage, which in turn adjusts the motor speed. The results of the system experiment show that the system is of better robustness and stronger practicality.

keywords.kw: DC Motor, improved Fuzzy-PID, hybrid control, speed regulating

article_rec.title: SPSS for Water Quality Assessment of Beijing Typical River Based on Principal Component Analysis

abstract.par: this paper researches on water quality condition of WenYu River basin in Beijing. According to stationing principle and field investigation, the whole basin is divided as 22 monitoring sections and 10 pollution indicators. By means of SPSS soft applied in principal component analysis method, paper analysis on the main pollution indicators and the main pollution contribution sections. The result shows four extracted principal components reflect 91.81% information of primitive variables. Then solve the formula of the four extracted principal components as F1, F2, F3, F4. According to the contribution percentage of variance in table, the function of comprehensive evaluation expression can be deduced as F= 0.692F1+0.125F2+0.106F3+0.077F4. The results show that among the 19 current perennial cross-sections, the worst water quality is in NO.14 section, the best water quality is in NO.12 section, the 19 cross-sections pollution status is in the order of NO.14>NO.7>NO.2>NO.1>NO.17>NO.6>NO.8>NO.19> NO.18>NO.13>NO.5>NO.3>NO.4>NO.15>NO.16>NO.11> NO.10> NO.9> NO.12. The assessment result is tally with the actual situation. Administrative means, technical means and management means are the effective measures to improve water quality of WenYu River basin.

keywords.kw: SPSS, principal component analysis, water quality assessment, tipical river of Beijing, prevention and treatment

article_rec.title: Stabilization for Linear Non-Gaussian Systems with Communication Constraints

abstract.par: This paper addresses the feedback stabilization problem for linear time-invariant systems with non-Gaussian state and output noises, where sensors and controllers are connected via a noisy digital communication channel. A sufficient condition for stabilization of the unstable plant in the presence of data-rate constraints, is derived. It is found that there exists a quantization, coding and control strategy above a lower bound of data rates of the channel such that all closed-loop trajectories tend asymptotically to zero. Simulations are done to verify the obtained theoretical results.

keywords.kw: linear non-Gaussian systems, digital communication channels, channel noise, feedback stabilization

article_rec.title: Stabilization of Networked Control Systems with Time Delay

abstract.par: This paper investigates the stabilization problem for networked control systems, where sensors, controllers and plants are connected by a digital communication network. A sufficient condition for stabilization of linear time-invariant systems is derived. An upper bound on the maximum allowable transfer interval, below which there exists a feedback control policy to stabilize the unstable plant, is proposed. Simulation results show the validity of the proposed control scheme.

keywords.kw: linear time-invariant systems, communication constraints, time delay, feedback stabilization

article_rec.title: Stabilization of Stochastic Continuous-Time Systems under Data-Rate Constraints

abstract.par: This paper investigates the stabilization problem for stochastic continuous-time linear systems with unknown precess disturbance, where the sensors and controllers are connected by a noiseless digital communication channel. A dynamic output feedback controller is employed to stabilize the unstable plant in the mean square sense. A sufficient condition for stabilization in the presence of limited data rates is derived. Simulation results show the validity of the proposed control scheme.

article_rec.title: Static Behaviors and Optimization Operation Techniques for Circulating Fluidized Bed Boiler

abstract.par: Some technical problems such as low thermal efficiency, high auxiliary power ratio and severe abrasion of heating surface are existed in the operation of circulating fluidized bed boilers which combust bad fuels generally, these disadvantages restrict the farther expansion of circulating fluidized bed boiler to the power field. Based on the balance of material, energy and carbon content, and on the guarantee of 900℃bed temperature and optimal oxygen concentration at the exit of furnace, the static operating variables: fuel, limestone, primary air, secondary air and bottom ash, are determined on different load, the operating parameters and structural parameters are taken into account such as coal type, limestone component, particle size distribution, bed pressure drop, desulfurization efficiency, boiler capacity, boiler structure and the performance of cyclone. A software for static behaviors of circulating fluidized bed boiler has been designed, this work can provide precious technical support for optimization operation of the boiler, and provide technical methods for the development of advanced circulating fluidized bed combustion technology.

keywords.kw: static behavior, optimization, operation, software, circulating fluidized bed boiler

article_rec.title: Steady-State Model Research of Nine Degrees of Freedom for Electric Vehicle with Motorized Wheels

abstract.par: A Steady-State model with nine degrees of freedom primarily used in driving mode for motorized wheels electric vehicle has been developed, in which the related equations of motion and the state variables are deduced. With Matlab/Simulink software, the computer simulation model is built. The kinematics properties of the model have been studied by the simulation of constant velocity steering and accelerated steering. The validity of the model is confirmed by simulation results and lays the foundation for the dynamic characteristic research of the vehicle with motorized wheels.

keywords.kw: electric vehicle, motorized wheel, steady-state model, dynamic model, Simulink, simulation

article_rec.title: Structure Performance Sensitivity Analysis of Hydraulic Press Upper Beam

abstract.par: the finite element model of upper beam is established. Using deformation and quality as structural performance evaluation indicator, the key parameters that affect upper beam’s structure performance are screened out. Obtained sequence of parameters that affects the structure properties of upper beam is as follows: upper and lower plate thickness, upper beam height, thickness of middle cross-plate, middle vertical plate thickness, and external plate thickness. The conclusions not only provide key dimension parameters for the optimization of hydraulic press mainframe, but also have some guidance for the design of other similar structural parts.

keywords.kw: hydraulic press, upper beam, sensitivity, structure properties

article_rec.title: Studies of Hydrodynamics of the Fluidized Bed Reactor

abstract.par: The hydrodynamics of a two-dimensional bed reactor were studied computationally. To describe the particulate phase stress in the Eulerian-Eulerian two-fluid model, the kinetic theory of granular flow has been used. Syamal O’Brien drag function was used to calculate momentum exchange coefficients between gas and solid phases. We specified diameter of glass beads which is 300μm and restitution coefficient which is 0.9. The boundary condition of walls was assumed as no slip. Simulation results such as flow field, distributions of velocity, volume fraction and pressure were obtained. Additional experimental studies and simulations involving chemical reactions need to be carried on.

keywords.kw: Fluidized bed, Eulerian-Eulerian, drag, volume fraction

article_rec.title: Studies on the Digital Expression of Al-Si Alloy Microstructure and Its Applications in Properties Analysis

abstract.par: In traditional metallograph analysis, the results were often varied from different observers. The concept of digital expression of Al-Si alloy microstructure was put forward, and the procedures of digital expression were also discussed in detail. This method was fit for processing the microstructure with granular secondary phase especially, and the results were certainly and could be reported in digital style with good comparability. A permanent mould Al-12wt%Si alloy casting with different wall thickness was designed to illustrate the application of microstructure digital expression. Some unusually results were found such as self-tempering and relation between microstructure and hardness in the digital processing of microstructure. The experimental results also showed that the primary silicon precipitated as needle like shape in thick and thin section, but as granule like shape in the transitional section. The finer and shorter of the needle like β-phase, the higher hardness of the sample possessed. And in general, the hardness in transitional section with granule β- phase was lower than those sections with needle β-phase. It was also found that the total average mean diameter were 1.326, 1.250 and 1.263 um respectively from thick section to thin section of the casting.

keywords.kw: Al-Si alloy, microstructure, metallograph, digital expression, application

article_rec.title: Study for Technology of Asphalt Pavement Aggregate Washed by Cycle Limewater

abstract.par: Technology of asphalt pavement aggregate washed by cycle limewater was put forward for the first time in this paper. Before and after the aggregate was washed by cycle limewater, aggregate mud content, aggregate asphalt adhesion and asphalt mixture water stability were tested. Test results showed that the aggregate mud content was reduced, and that the aggregate asphalt adhesion and the asphalt mixture water stability were all enhanced. At the same time, asphalt pavement construction energy consumption and CO2, SO2 gas emissions were all reduced by this technology. Therefore, the technology of asphalt pavement aggregate washed by cycle limewater was conducive to environmental protection and sustainable development.

keywords.kw: energy conservation, emissions reduction, cycle limewater, wash, asphalt pavement aggregate

article_rec.title: Study of a New Type High Power Motor Intelligent Soft Start Controller

abstract.par: In response to industry power motor cannot directly starting and stopping issues, a new type intelligent design of soft starter is proposed in this paper. Intelligent soft starter design principles based on 89LV52 single chip is articulated. The hardware circuit design, software flow design and test data analysis are given in details. By producting in Zibo Galaxy high-technology development co., Ltd. it shows that this smart soft starter has the characteristics which are flexible parameter setting, intuitive liquid crystal display, diverse starting way, precise current limiting protection, accurate protection of lack phase, low-cost. So it has broad application prospects.

keywords.kw: Soft Start, 89LV52 Singlechip, Liquid Crystal Display(LCD)

article_rec.title: Study of Electrochemical Finishing with Magnetic Field and High-Frequency Group Pulse

abstract.par: With magnetic field and high-frequency group pulse, the experimental methods and mechanisms of electrochemical finishing have been investigated. Using the high-frequency group pulse power, an equipment that different magnetic field intensity can be imposed on the work piece through it was invented. In the experiment, the influence of different magnetic field intensity has been studied. With some orthogonal experiments, the interaction influence of multiple parameters to the finishing has been investigated and proved. By analyzing the experimental results, It can be concluded that the high-frequency group pulse current produced a specific magnetic field and it affected the result. In the experiment, the Ra is influenced by both of the two magnetic field.

keywords.kw: High-Frequency Group Pulse, Magnetic Field, Composite Finishing, Interaction

article_rec.title: Study of Forward Method on Imaging of Nugget in Resistance Spot Welding

abstract.par: Inversion imaging of nugget in resistance spot welding (RSW) is a new developing method of monitoring the welding quality in RSW in recent years, which is based on the rapid developments of the inverse problems in mathematics and physics. This paper does some research on the forward problem of inversion imaging of nugget and establishes the forward model of RSW on the basis of the forward theory and the electromagnetic field theory. And the soft wares of MATLAB and ANSYS are used to simulate the electromagnetic field of the forward model. The model’s reliability is verified by comparing the experimental results with the simulated results, which makes a good foundation for the inversion imaging of nugget in RSW.

keywords.kw: Nugget, Magnetic Flux Density, Forward Model, Simulation, Resistance Spot Welding

article_rec.title: Study of Inherent Safety Mine Hoist Based on Modern Design Methods

abstract.par: As a modern security design, Inherent Safety means that equipment and facilities is able to contain the inherent fundamental features to prevent accidents. Mine hoist is the most important equipment in the coal production. How to achieve safe, reliable, efficient production, has been the focus study at home and abroad. Inherent safety is reflected in hoist design, primarily through the design measures to improve the operation of hoist safety and reliability. In this paper, Inherent Safety theory is applied in the design of mine hoist, to proposed the design method by using the software of PRO/E,PLC, Lab view etc..

keywords.kw: Mine hoist, Inherent Safety, PRO/E, PLC, Labview

article_rec.title: Study on Characteristics of Palygorskite in Purification of Petroleum Contaminated Groundwater

abstract.par: The natural paly gorskite modified was as reactive media of PRB. Based on the investigation of effect of specific hydro chemical factors, such as Fe2+, Fe3+, Mn2+, NO3-, SO42- etc.,on remediation efficiency of petroleum contaminated groundwater, the dynamics, isothermal adsorption model and characterization of reactive media were studied. The results showed that the effect of purifying TPH with the palygorskite modified was best when concentration of Fe2+, Mn2+ and SO42- were 0-30, 0-10 and 0-50 mg/L, respectively. The purification process of TPH was achieved quickly and the removal rate was 92.82% in 30 minutes. The absorption kinetics was followed pseudo-second order kinetics. The adsorption process fitted the Langmuir isothermal models. The apparent maximum adsorption capacity was 2.5g/g. The characteristics of palygorskite modified were acicular or fibrous, some other crystals gathering in it, more pores, very large specific surface area, it had the advantage to remove TPH from petroleum contaminated groundwater by absorption method.

keywords.kw: palygorskite, purification, petroleum contaminated groundwater, characteristics

article_rec.title: Study on Direct Kinematic Solution for Parallel Robots with 6 Freedoms Based on Interval Analysis

abstract.par: A new numerical method based on interval analysis is presented for direct kinematic solution for parallel robots. After the interval function is built, the initial search box can be gained through interval analysis, which will be tested and bisected until all of the convergent intervals are obtained. Then, the classical iterate method is employed to get all the point solution in each interval.

keywords.kw: Parallel Robot, Kinematic Analysis, Direct Kinematic Solution, Interval Analysis

article_rec.title: Study on Dynamic Characteristics of a Hydraulic Hammer

abstract.par: Hydraulic hammers are used widely now in construction fields such as road, civil engineering, port, and mines. How to design them optimally, and how to control their working and improve working efficiency are interested to many researchers and manufacturers. The dynamic characteristics of them will affect their performance and working efficiency. To investigate these problems and to improve efficiency of their analysis, the study is done based on the software ADAMS. According to working principle of a hydraulic hammer, a dynamic model of hydraulic system coupling with mechanical system is established in ADAMS/Hydraulics here. Some important and interesting phenomena, and especially its dynamic characteristics are found by study of piston motion, oil flow and accumulator pressure in the hydraulic system, and some important working parameters affecting the normal working of the hydraulic system are also found, which can be used to guide optimal design of hydraulic hammers.

keywords.kw: Dynamics, hydraulic hamme, ADAMS, simulation

article_rec.title: Study on Effect of Valve Operation on Transient Flow in Natural Gas Pipelines

abstract.par: One-dimensional, non-isothermal gas flow model was adopted to simulate the transients in high-pressure gas transmission pipelines. The conservative equations based on the equation of state of BWRS, including mass, momentum and energy laws, were solved with the method of characteristics. Meanwhile, laboratory experiments with the focus on effect of valve operation on pipeline parameters were carried out. Both results of numerical simulation and experiment suggested that quick operation of valve could arouse significant fluctuation of flow rate and pressure of flow within the pipeline.

keywords.kw: natural gas, dynamic simulation, fast transients, valves

article_rec.title: Study on Effective Wall Thickness in Arid and Semi-arid Areas

abstract.par: In arid and semi-arid areas, the diurnal and annual temperature ranges are large. Taking reasonable measures of thermal insulation, the indoor thermal environment can be comfort. The traditional dwellings, in arid and semi-arid areas of western China, have energy efficient characteristic, among which Yaodong is the typical representative. In this paper, the temperature in Yaodong wall will be tested and calculated to research the scientific mechanism of energy conservation. And then the effective wall thickness will be calculated by the periodic thermal transfer mechanism. This method offers a theoretical basis for low energy building design in arid and semi-arid areas.

keywords.kw: Yaodong dwelling, attenuation, effective wall thickness

article_rec.title: Study on Energy Saving Lighting of Classroom Based on Cirtopic

abstract.par: The study of energy saving lighting in the classrooms aliases on the pupil area comparing coefficient K (Ap), the luminance contrast coefficient based on pupil change R (L)p, It is shown that, to achieve the same visual performance (with the equal pupil area), 6500K and 4000K color temperature fluorescent lamps are needed to generate less luminance than 2700K, and also save more energy. Therefore, the appropriate color temperature light source is concerned with energy saving lighting in classrooms.

keywords.kw: Classroom Lighting, Pupil Change, Cirtopic, Energy-Saving Lighting

article_rec.title: Study on Factors of Affecting a New SBR Reactor for Nutrient Removal from Municipal Sewage

abstract.par: A piece of baffle was introduced into conventional SBR reactor, forming a rotative flow pattern and two reaction areas. In the experiment, the influences of factor as hydraulic retention time (HRT), influent NH3-N concentration, and aeration mode, on the nutrient removal from municipal sewage were investigated. The results show us that when the operating period and aeration time are 6.0 h and 4.0 h, respectively, the system removal efficiency reaches optimal with the removal rate of CODCr, NH3-N, TN and TP of 85%, 99%, 81% and 79%, separately. There are no obvious distances among the treatment effects of decar bonization and nitrification in the imited, unlimited, and semi-limite aeration modes. The removal rate of CODCr, NH3-N, and TN all reach above 82%, 97%, and 80%, respectively. But only with Semi-limited aeration, we can get a satisfying removal rate of TP.

keywords.kw: SBR, hydraulic retention time, ammonia concentration, aeration mode, nutrient removal

article_rec.title: Study on Fractal of Silt Floc Pores and the Settling Character of Silt Floc

abstract.par: A new method, using fractal dimension of silt floc pores to study the settling performance of silt floc, was put forward. Firstly, the fractal characteristics of silt floc pores were descried qualitatively by the software of image-pro plus6.0, which was taken from Shahu Lake in Wuhan city. Secondly, two-dimensional fractal dimension of silt floc pores was calculated by image analysis. At last, the settling velocity of silt floc was estimated by the fractal dimension of silt floc pores, which compared with the traditional method. The conclusion given in this paper showed that porosity of silt floc may be reflected by the fractal properties, and the settling velocity of silt floc reduced with the fractal dimension of silt floc pores increasing.

keywords.kw: fractal dimension, settling velocity

article_rec.title: Study on Friction Coefficient of Liquid Flow through a Rectangular Microchannel with Electrokinetic Effects

abstract.par: The influences of the electrical double layer(EDL) field near a solid-liquid interface and induced electro kinetic field on pressure-driven liquid flow through micro channels are analyzed. The equation governing the EDL field in the cross section of rectangular channels is a nonlinear, two-dimensional Poisson–Boltzmann equation. A body force caused by the EDL field and induced electro kinetic field is considered in the equation of motion. The governing equations are numerically solved with the use of a finite control volume scheme. The electro kinetic effects on the flow velocity and the friction coefficient for the micro channel are discussed. The results show that the flow velocity in micro channel predicted by the model with electro kinetic effect is lower than that predicted by the the macro scale fluid theory (without electro kinetic effect). The friction coefficients predicted by the model with electro kinetic effect were found to be higher than that predicted by the macro scale fluid theory. It is different from that the friction coefficient predicted by the macro scale fluid theory for a rectangular channel is dependently only on the aspect ratio (H/W). The friction coefficient of the micro scale liquid flow is influenced by the ionic concentration of the liquid, the zeta potential and the size of micro channels. The friction coefficient increases as the ionic concentration of the aqueous solution decreases in the same micro channel. And stronger deviations were observed as the hydraulic diameter decreases with the same aspect ratio.

keywords.kw: electokinetic effect, friction coefficient, finite control volume scheme, Poisson-Boltzmann equation, microchannel

article_rec.title: Study on G.711 Voice Communication of IP Video Intercom System

abstract.par: The paper presents a solution to voice conflict of IP video intercom system and achieve voice communication by studying voice communication of IP intercom system. This solution applies G.711used widely to code and decode and also applies UDP transmission protocol for real-time transmission. It solves the problems of voice-conflict, voice delay and voice’s quality.

keywords.kw: IP, voice communication, G.711

article_rec.title: Study on Heat Storage Tank of Solar Heating System

abstract.par: The relationships among solar radiation intensity, volume of heat storage tank, heating load and heat storage temperature difference has been revealed by the theoretical analysis on heat storage tank in active solar water heating system. Heat storage volume can be concluded with the simulation and analysis on solar water heating system in northwest area of China. And then, the nodal model of heat storage tank is simulated in different conditions with the help of CFD. The results show that the heat storage volume is diminished with increasing of heat storage temperature difference, and for practical project, the recommended values of heat storage volume in different cities are given. The lower water velocity at the inlet of heat storage tank is, the more obviously the layers are, and the recommended water velocity is between 0.01 and 0.05m/s.

keywords.kw: solar water heating, heat storage tank, heating load, CFD, temperature stratification

article_rec.title: Study on Imbalance Vibration Signal Separation of Motor Spindle Based on EMD Method

abstract.par: It is the hypothesis of imbalance vibration monitoring and dynamic balance to separate the imbalance vibration signal accurately. The compositive method of accurate imbalance vibration signal separation was given based on some methods, such as signal forecasting and extension of time series model, EMD and correlation analysis etc. The principle and procedure of the method were introduced in detail based on radial vibration signal analysis of the motor spindle. In order to test the validity of the method, further unbalance experimentation and signal separation were carried out.

keywords.kw: EMD, Motor Spindle, Imbalance Vibration, Signal Separation

article_rec.title: Study on Improving the Dead Zone Character of Electro-Hydraulic Servo System with Dither

abstract.par: A novel approach to improve the character of nonlinearity is proposed with adding dither signal which has high frequency and small amplitude. The mathematics model of the dither signal effect on dead zone element is established using the equivalent gain, the principle how to eliminate dead zone is discussed particularly. A simulation example of electro-hydraulic servo vibration table is implemented, and the result demonstrates that the dither signal can eliminate dead zone effectively, enhance the control character obviously, and this study has practical significance in engineering.

keywords.kw: nonlinear system, dither signal, electro-hydraulic servo system, dead zone

article_rec.title: Study on Model of Material Remove Rate During Ultrasonic Vibration Assisted Electrical Discharge Machining in Gas Medium

abstract.par: Electrical discharge machining (EDM) is widely used for manufacturing various kinds of dies and molds. While it can bring some disadvantages such as environmental pollution. EDM in gas is a new technology and based on which a new EDM method called ultrasonic vibration assisted EDM in gas medium is proposed in this paper. The principle of ultrasonic vibration assisted electrical discharge machining in gas medium was introduced in this work and relevant experimental equipment was designed by which a serious of experiments was carried out. The model of MRR (material remove rate) taking the effect of ultrasonic cavitation during ultrasonic vibration assisted electrical discharge machining in gas medium was deduced. Experimental results showed that the MRR increases with the increase of peak discharge voltage, discharge pulse-on time, discharge peak current and gas pressure, but decreases with the increase of pulse-off time, which accord with the model of MRR.

keywords.kw: model, MRR, ultrasonic vibration, electrical discharge machining, gas

article_rec.title: Study on Modeling Simulation of Long-Span Gantry NC Machining Center Structure

abstract.par: The structure of traditional machine tool is designed through experience, analogy, and static traditional design method. The machine structure was heavy and design cycle is long. So the cost is expensive. Therefore, there are a lot of places need improvements. The finite element model of the beam structure was structured by using three-dimensional CAD modeling software-UG NX4.0 and finite element analysis software-ANSYS. And then the whole beam's static and dynamic characteristics were obtained. The double wall structure of the beam with optimized static and dynamic performance was given on the basis of simulations. The Y direction-the maximal displacement direction of the beam was obtained. The maximum displacement for 0.0289 mm in middle and spindle box beam contact point. Through the analysis of the beam, the machine can see the integral structure stiffness and strength, especially the strength. The use of finite element theory and modal analysis theory was used at the design stage of machine tools. The job performance and processing accuracy can be improved, and the development cycle can be shortened.

keywords.kw: Machine tool, Static analysis, Finite element analysis, Process optimization, Modal analysis

article_rec.title: Study on Nitrate-N Removal by a Catalytic Electrolysis Method in Water

abstract.par: A new method for Nitrate-N removal in water has been presented in this paper, and related experiments have been carried out to study its technical characteristics. Results showed that in designed electrolysis system, Fe modified Ti substrate cathode can catalytic reduce NO3 –N to NH4 +-N under suitable conditions. Furthermore NH4 +-N can be oxidized to N2-N in same system by supporting of Cl-. Under the conditions of Cl- addition quantity of 500mg/L, current density of 12 mA/cm2, plate distance of 9mm, stirring intensity of 450rpm, and electrolysis time of 150min, about 94.3% NO3 –N and 94.1% TN can be removed, even no NO2 –N or NH4 +-N is produced. Moreover mechanism has been analyzed based on bimetal catalytic reduction and obtained results. The adsorption effect of Fe to O and reductant attacking may be considered as the major cause of NO3 –N reduction. And chlorine oxidation may be the reason of NH4 +-N harmlessly removing

keywords.kw: nitrate, catalytic reduction, electrolysis, ammonia, chlorine oxidation

article_rec.title: Study on Nitrite, Nitrate and Ammonia (NNA) Pollution of Goundwater in Typical Urbanization Areas

abstract.par: In the urbanization process of Guangzhou, which was characterized by highly centered economy and fast utilized resources, groundwater environment was influenced severely. High concentration of NO2 - and NH4 + in groundwater concentrated in the city center, and samples with over proof NO3 - distributed around the city and hilly areas, besides in the central region. Groundwater contaminations caused by human are complex. There have been various reasons for nitrite, nitrate and ammonia (NNA) pollution of the groundwater which are mainly resulted from human activities such as domestic, industrial and agricultural activities. In addition, the NNA contamination is also related to strata sedimentary features of the plain area, groundwater formation and occurrence conditions. The forms of nitrogen distribution in Guangzhou groundwater environment are affected significantly by hydrogeology conditions and hydrogeochemical factors, such as redox environment, lithology of vadose zone, recharge, runoff and discharge conditions, content of Fe and Mn in water and soil, the degree of acidification and so on.

keywords.kw: Guangzhou, groundwater environment, NNA pollution

article_rec.title: Study on Paper-Based Fiberboard and Vacuum Treatment

abstract.par: According to the required fiber quality and the technical conditions of manufacturing fiberboard, the technology on paper-based fiberboard manufacturing and vacuum treatment was studied. After thorough investigation, the optimum technical conditions have been gained as follows: hot pressing temperature 160℃, hot pressing time 6 min, forming pressure 11MPa and the quantity of adhesive 10 percent. After vacuum treatment by the steam jet system in conditions as chamber below 700 Pascal, temperature in chamber 80℃, treatment time two hours, the contained proportion and emission quantity of the urea formaldehyde resin meet the requirements of GBT11718-1999. In addition to this, the mechanical properties of the paper-based fiberboard are greatly improved at the same time.

keywords.kw: Paper-based, Fiberboard, Steam Jet, Vacuum Treatment

article_rec.title: Study on Photocatalytic Mechanism of Fe3+ -TiO2 -Zeolite for Oilfield Wastewater Treatment

abstract.par: The composite photo catalyst of Fe3 +-TiO2–Zeolite is prepared in a bench scale, which is immobilized into a zeolite matrix by means of sol-gel technique. The oilfield wastewater in Huabei oilfield was chosen as the model pollutant to evaluate photo catalytic activity under the ultraviolet light and sunlight irradiation respectively, the possible mechanism of photo catalytic oxidation was deduced. The results indicated that under conditions of the calcined temperature of 500 ℃, the composite photo catalyst was got by loading nano-TiO2 of 43% and doping Fe3+ ions concentration of 6.04 1016 ions/cm3. COD concentration degraded could follow the first order kinetics and could meet the second national discharge standard of China. Meanwhile, the mechanism of doped Fe3+ in complex photo catalysts can capture the electrons in the conduction band, reduce the recombined rate of electrons with cavities, and improve the efficiency of light quantum.

keywords.kw: photocatalyst, nano-TiO2, zeolite, oilfield wastewater, COD removal

article_rec.title: Study on Sono-photocatalytic Degradation of Chlorobenzene in Wastewater

abstract.par: Chlorobenzene(CB), one of the persistent organic pollutants (POPs), is a refractory semivolation organic compound and non-biodegradable. Treatment of CB contaminated wastewater by traditional method is essentially impossible. In the study, the sono-photocatalytic degradation of CB was examined in aqueous suspension using the TiO2 as photo catalyst. Some factors affecting the degradation rate of CB were also studied. The results indicated the chlorobenzene underwent a fast degradation. In the process, the pH value of the dispersion had little effect on the degradation rate of CB, while the amount of TiO2, initial concentration of CB and H2O2 affected it greatly.

keywords.kw: chlorobenzene, ultrasonic, titanium dioxide, sonophotocatalysis, degradation

article_rec.title: Study on Spatial Panel Analysis of Inter-provincial Carbon Emissions Based on STIRPAT Model in China

abstract.par: Spatial panel models of inter-provincial carbon emissions impact factors were established based on STIRPAT model in China. A spatial autocorrelation test of carbon emissions of each province in China from 1997 to 2007 had been done. Then, a spatial panel analysis of carbon emissions impact factors including total population, per capita GDP, and energy intensity was done. Conclusion: the activities of interprovincial carbon emissions are significantly positive correlated. Population, per capita GDP and energy intensity are highly significant effect on carbon emissions.

keywords.kw: STIRPAT model, carbon emissions, Spatial panel data model

article_rec.title: Study on the Application of Sensors Array Technique for Monitor Spot Welding Quality

abstract.par: The valid method study for welding quality monitor has become a serious problem. It is difficult to use single sensor to identify the quality of actual nugget because of the affected factors in the welding process. A spot welding quality monitor system based on the sensors array technique is developed. A modified signal processing algorithm based on Fast ICA is proposed to extract the objected signals. The purpose is first to choose a perfectible way for the annular sensors array, then use the modified Fast ICA algorithm to extract the objective signals. The result shows that the best arranging way for the sensors array is the un-balanced model. And the magnetic signal source can be well separated with the modified Fast ICA method during the welding process.

keywords.kw: spot welding, magnetic field, sensors array, Independent Component Analysis

article_rec.title: Study on the Deep-Treatment with Microelectrolysis-fenton Method of Middle-Stage Wastewater of Poplar PRC-APMP Pulping

abstract.par: To solve the problems of the papermaking wastewater new discharge standards and reuse The microelectrolysis-fenton process has been applied to the advanced treatment of middle-stage wastewater with of poplar PRC-APMP Pulping. The effects of operational conditions such as Fe/C, pH, iron quantity, H2O2 dosage and reaction time, have been experimental studied, subsequently the best handles technological conditions have been gained. The experimental results show that when pH is 4.0, H2O2 dosage is 15mmol/L, Fe/C ratio 1.5, iron quantity10mg/L and reaction time 40min can make the treating effect best, the removal efficiencies of color and CODcr are 89.6% and 75.4% respectively The quality of the final water not only can completely satisfies the new discharge standard （GB3544—2008）, but also the recycle requirements.

keywords.kw: poplar PRC-APMP Pulping, deeply treatment, microelectrolysis-fenton process, new discharge standard

article_rec.title: Study on the Eco-correlative Variation of Hydroenergy Resource System in Space-Time Variation and the Counter-Measures

abstract.par: From the mutual relation between hydro energy resource system and ecosystem, analyzes the theoretical basis for space-time variation of hydro energy resource system and ecosystem, and the concrete mechanism of the two systems. The study shows that seen from the smaller range of time dimension, the emphasis is embodied in different phases of hydro energy resource exploitation to ecosystem element interference, from the larger dimension, the emphasis should fall into effects at different succession phases. Besides, the investigator’s vision is also an important factor influencing the correlation effect evaluation. From space dimension, the geological differences influence evaluation and embodiment toward the ecological effects. Based on the above analysis, accommodation for the correlation of hydro energy resource system and ecosystem should be done by a multiple-dimension comprehensive adjustment system from space and time dimensions so as to facilitate the fulfillment of interactive development.

keywords.kw: hydroenergy resource system, ecological correlation, space-time variation

article_rec.title: Study on the Image Processing Algorithm for Detecting the Seed-Sowing Performance

abstract.par: An image processing algorithm was developed for detecting a seed-sowing device’s performance in this paper. Firstly, sequential images of the seeds on the conveyor belt of the test-bed were obtained using a camera by sensor triggering. These sequential images were then spliced into a single long image. Using discriminate analysis techniques, a threshold of the binary image was automatically obtained. According to the threshold, seeds could be abstracted from the background of the long image. The seed number on the binary image can be counted using the median as the single seed area (pixels number). Based on the information of longitudinal and transverse projection on the binary image, the breadth of the seed array, the coordinates of the seed array central and the distance between seed arrays, seed intervals and non-seed intervals of each seed array were obtained. Finally, for drill seeding, hill-drop seeding and precise seeding, more performance parameters could be further calculated based on the measurement parameters mentioned above.

keywords.kw: Seed-sowing Device, Performance Detection, Image Processing Algorithm

article_rec.title: Study on the Model of Torpedo's Best Service Year

abstract.par: Determining of the torpedo’s service year reasonably, it is an effective way to reduce the military expenses expenditure, and forecast the torpedo economic life. We can forecast the data of exponential use maintenance cost by using the grey metabolism model. In order to improve the prediction precision, the data was divided into several groups, and prediction residual was modified by using neural network. Finally it is verified that the method is reasonable by an example.

keywords.kw: torpedo, maintaining cost, metabolism GM(1, 1) model, BP neural network, forecasting

article_rec.title: Study on the Out-of-Plane Stability of Bending Beam under Non-conservative Force

abstract.par: The out-of-plane stability of bending beam, which is made up with 2 beams and under non-conservative force, is studied. Bending deflection and tensional deformation differential equation of each beam is established in critical condition. According to compatibility conditions of deformation, the characteristic equation is obtained to calculate out-of-plane stability of the cantilever bending beam. The stability of upwards-bent and downwards-bent beam under non-conservative force is discussed in detail, also the effect of non-conservation force on the stability is studied. The result indicates that the out-of-plane stability improved greatly while considering the effect of non-conservation force.

keywords.kw: Bending Beam, Cantilever, Out-of-plane Stability, Non-conservative Force, Derrick Crane

article_rec.title: Study on the Urban Road Runoff Pollution Characteristics in Xiangtan

abstract.par: As the main portion of urban catchment, road is also a major non-point pollution source of receiving water body. The road runoff pollution has attracted wide attention. The paper makes a study on six rainfall road runoff from 3 different types of roads, analyses the status of road runoff pollution, the surface runoff pollution load and correlation between road runoff pollutants. The result shows that the concentrations of COD, TN, TP and Pb all exceed the fifth standard of The Environmental Quality Standards for Surface Water. The annual pollution load of Xiangtan urban-road runoff is LCOD=2777.612, LTN=121.971t, LTP=15.088t , LPb=7.386t, LZn=0.764t. The correlation coefficients between COD, TN, TP, Pb, Zb concentration and SS content are all larger than 0. 85 (R2>0.85). The pollution of urban-road surface runoff can be reduced by increasing the frequency of road sweeping.

keywords.kw: Xiangtan city, non-point source pollution, surface runoff, pollution load

article_rec.title: Study on the Respirable Particulate Matter Generated from the Petroleum Coke and Coal Mixed-Fired CFB Boiler

abstract.par: The dust generated from the fuel combustion is one of the important sources for air pollution. This paper has made a comprehensive research on the particulate matter generated from the petroleum coke and coal mixed-fired circulating fluidized bed (CFB) boiler. Four kinds of ash were studied including the ash from the electrostatic precipitator(ESP), the ash from the bag filter, PM10 collected at the entrance of the ESP and the export of the bag filter. The results of the analysis of particle size show that PM10 of the entrance present the three peaks distribution due to the different formation mechanisms. The chemical composition analysis was conducted to deduce the formation mechanisms based on the current PM formation theory in combustion. The result indicates that there are two kinds of micron particles found, some are fuel generated, others are limestone generated. The bigger the particles are, the more limestone generated particles can be found.

keywords.kw: petroleum coke, respirable particulate matter, air pollution, circulating fluidized bed boiler

article_rec.title: Study on Thermal Performance in Winter of Building Envelope Walls Insulated with Expanded Polystyrene Board

abstract.par: Building energy consumption is tremendous in China. The energy consumption of building envelope walls is 4- 5 times higher compared with that of developed countries. The envelope walls built by solid clay brick and other masonry materials have a poor thermal insulation performance, and can not meet the requirements of building energy efficiency. This paper investigates the thermal performance in winter of thermal insulation composite walls in Beijing area by using response factor method and finite difference method. The results show that the external solid brick walls composed with 50 mm thick expanded polystyrene board on their outside surfaces can reduce the hourly heat transfer about 67.5%, the peak value of heat transfer of the composite wall reduced and changed flatly, it has a good heat stability which is benefit for building energy conservation and the operation and control of heating equipment, the hourly unsteady-state temperature of the inner surface of the composite wall is much closer to the requirement of the indoor temperature in winter compared to that of the traditional solid brick wall, the indoor environment of composite wall has a good thermal comfort.

keywords.kw: Ennergy Efficiency, Building Envelope Wall, Thermal Insulation, Winter, Thermal Performance

article_rec.title: Study on Treatment Technology of Waste Emulsion in Mechanical Processing

abstract.par: The paper studied the trearment technology of high concentration emulsion wastewater in metal machining plant. By analyzing the properties of emulsion wastewater, we used the combination process of membrane technology+Fe-C micro-electrolysis+membrane bioreactor to treat the wastewater. Through the ceramic membrane, The removal rate of CODCr can reach 95%. Fe-C micro-electrolysis treatment can improve the biodegradability of wastewater, lastly through the membrane bioreactor treatment systems, CODCr of the effluent is less than 100mg/L, which meets the requirements of The First Grade of the National Discharge Standard（GB8978-1996）.

keywords.kw: waste emulsion, membrane separation, micro electrolysis, membrane bio-reactor

article_rec.title: Study on Virtual Measurement of Flow Rate Characteristics of Discharge Solenoid Valve

abstract.par: Geometric model for discharge from a tank is presented, and after meshing, setting initial conditions and boundary conditions, the discharge process is simulated and the mass flow rate, pressure and temperature during discharge are obtained. Through comparing the results of numerical simulation and experiment for pressure and temperature curves, it can be found they are approximate, which shows that the simulation results are very reliable. With simulation results, the flow rate characteristics which are virtually measured are close to that of ISO6358, and the relative errors of sonic conductance and critical pressure ratio are about 1% and 3%, respectively. This method is energy-saving and has a broad prospect in application.

keywords.kw: Numerical simulation, Virtual measurement, Flow rate characteristics

article_rec.title: Survey on Building Energy Consumption Using Statistics Principle

abstract.par: Grasping the status of buildings energy consumption is the foundation of buildings energy saving. Facing plenty of buildings, statistics principle should be used to make survey data representative. In this paper, survey manner, sampling method and calculation of sample size had been investigated. Because of lacking of test sampling data, simulation was used as a substitute of survey sampling. In order to gain the sample size without sum of buildings, the relation between sample size and sum of buildings was obtained. Sample sizes of energy consumption survey of several cities in China were analyzed.

keywords.kw: survey on building energy consumption, statistics principle, sample size

article_rec.title: Synergistic Removal Function of Desulfurization Devices in Coal-fired Power Plants

abstract.par: It’s of vital importance to study on the synergistic removal function of wet flue gas desulphurization (WFGD) technologies in coal-fired power plants and take a comprehensive evaluation on their environmental benefits. By comparing and analyzing the dust and heavy metals before-and-after desulphurization devices of coal-fired power plants in Shanghai, we have found that 1) The synergistic removal function of dust depends on the dust concentration at the entrance of desulphurization devices. 2) Desulfurization devices do have some effects on removing heavy metals. 3) The particles arranged densely at the entrance of desulphurization devices are usually of spherical shapes and uniform sizes that under micron level. While those at the exit of desulfurization devices have variable size distribution and some of them appear agglomerated. 4) The gypsum rain is strongly acid and has a great impact on the environment around because of serious corrosion.

keywords.kw: Synergistic removal function, Scanning electron microscope (SEM), Gypsum rain

article_rec.title: Synthesis and Properties of Novel Post Cross-Linked Sulfonated Poly (arylene Ether sulfone)s for Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cell Applications

abstract.par: A series of novel cross-linked sulfonated poly(arylene ether sulfone)s were prepared. The membrane performance were significantly improved after cross-linking treatment, for example, the cross-linked membranes showed lower water uptake and lower swelling ratio than the corresponding original ones. With the increase of cross-linking extent, the water uptake and dimensional change decreased, while reasonably high proton conductivity was maintained.

keywords.kw: cross-linking, sulfonated poly (arylene ether sulfone), membrane, proton conductivity

article_rec.title: Target Tracking System Based on Wireless Sensor Networks

abstract.par: This paper discusses the development of a wireless sensor network based target tracking platform. The platform involves ultrasound sensors for target detection and extended Kalman filter (EKF) for tracking a single target. The embedded application is implemented by TinyOS/nesC[1], and Lab view is used to develop the GUI. In order to optimize the energy consumption and to prolong the lifetime of the network, a scheme of tasking node selection is proposed, which provides tradeoff between target tracking precision and energy consumption. The experiment results validate the effectiveness of the tasking node selection scheme.

keywords.kw: WSNs, EKF, target tracking, tasking node selection scheme

article_rec.title: Techniques of Polarization State Control for Interferential Distributed Optic-Fiber Sensing System

abstract.par: In the long distance distributed optic-fiber sensing system, the polarization state of output light tends to drift, which influences the sensing system interference effect. Aiming at the typical Mach-Zehnder distributed optic-fiber leak detection system, analyzes theoretically the influence of polarization degradation on the system performance, elaborates the technologies using the PDR and FRM to control the polarization state. Simulation results indicate these two technologies can achieve good effect of polarization control.

keywords.kw: Optic-fiber Sensing System, Polarization State, Mach-Zehnder, Polarization Diversity Receiver, Faraday Rotation Mirror

article_rec.title: Technology of Gear Shaping of Face Gear and Experimental Studies

abstract.par: Face gear is the major parts of helicopter transmissions for split torque equipment. The process generation of face gear is critical factors to prevent the face gear drive to be applied. A novice method is proposed for face gear generated by use of a general shaper. Face gear design and geometry were investigated that include tooth generation, limiting inner and outer radii, tooth contact analysis of gear drive. A face gear with 89 teeth was generated successfully by the shaper. In order to demonstrate the bearing contact of face gear drive, an experimental investigation was also developed in the bevel gear meshing machine. The results show the bearing contact of face gear drive is correspondence to the computerized design, which validated the feasibility of face gear shaping by a general shaper.

keywords.kw: face gear drive, bearing contact, shaper, undercutting and pointing

article_rec.title: The Adsorption Characteristic of Heavy Metals from Electroplating Wastewater on delta-MnO2 / Polymeric Ferric Sulfate

abstract.par: The work investigated that delta-MnO2 / Polymeric ferric sulfate (PFS) treated on electroplating wastewater containing heavy metal ions Cu2+, Pb2+, Cr3+. Effect adsorption on the pH, the amount of adsorbent, the input order and ratio of delta-MnO2 / PFS, the research determined the laboratory simulated electroplating wastewater treatment process and other basic parameters. The results showed that the best acidic conditions was pH = 7 ~ 8, and delta-MnO2 combined with PFS adsorption on heavy metals of wastewater with Cu2+, Pb2+, Cr3+ was better than the single use of delta-MnO2 and PFS, delta-MnO2: PFS for the 3:1 quality ratio, the first dosage of delta-MnO2 stirring for half an hour then plus PFS mixing 2 hours, the heavy metal ions Cu2+, Pb2+, Cr3+ from wastewater in the removal rate of 98.8%, 98.1% and 99.3% ion concentrations were lower than 1.0mg / L. The results were in line with the national emission standards.

keywords.kw: d-MnO2, Polymeric ferric sulfate, electroplating wastewater, heavy metal, adsorption

article_rec.title: The Affection of Spray Time to the Performance of the Free Piston Engine

abstract.par: Free piston engine is a hot research spot recently for its high efficiency and low emission in auto industry and heavy-duty industry. A multidimensional simulation was set up by using Fire( AVL). Analysis the previous conclusions and the simulation results, the emission performance of engine is better than convention no matter when to spray. But the efficiency of engine is affected by the spray time, it's better to arranged the spray time before TDC.

keywords.kw: Free Piston Engine, conventional engine, heat release rate, emission profermance

article_rec.title: The Application of Float-Encoding Genetic Algorithm in Optimizing Parameters of Fuzzy Controller

abstract.par: The paper presented a method of optimizing the parameters of fuzzy controller based on float-encoding genetic algorithm. Research on the efficiency of float-encoding was demonstrated. The results of simulation indicated the high efficiency of float-encoding genetic algorithm in multi-parameter optimizing．

keywords.kw: Float-encoding GA, Fuzzy control, Multi-parameter optimizing

article_rec.title: The Application of MPI-TigerSHARC in SAR Processing System

abstract.par: The demand of processing speed in SAR signal processing is huge and requires more computational power than what a single processor can provide. To address these demands, an implementation of MPI (Message Passing Interface) based on link DMA for TigerSHARC DSPs is introduced in this paper. Porting MPI to the embedded system will enhance application portability and make parallel programming much easier. This paper presents a real application of range-Doppler algorithm in SAR processing system. The result shows that MPI is suitable for parallel programming, especially suitable for processing large volume of data.

keywords.kw: MPI, Synthetic Aperture Radar, parallel computing, embedded systems

article_rec.title: The Application of Recycled Concrete Environmental Impact Analysis

abstract.par: If the building is not reasonable utilization of waste, which will bring increased production of cement industry, will produce larger environmental problems. This aspect is the current civil and environmental problems needed to resolve important. This paper compares and summarizes the way how the reuse of concrete material, can be used fully in three aspects. One is the concrete aggregates can substitute renewable part of asphalt concrete used in granite. Second is the aggregate concrete can be used to regenerate sub grade materials. The third is the concrete aggregate concrete brick regeneration. That building concrete recycling is the effective way to solve environmental problems. The study shows that the most effective use of the concrete way is processed into renewable aggregate used in the production of recycled concrete.

keywords.kw: Building materials, Recycled concrete, Environ mental problems

article_rec.title: The Application of Response Surface Method and Orthogonal Experiment Design in the Optimum Design for Drawbead Geometry Parameters

abstract.par: Draw bead geometry parameters have a significant effect to the quality of sheet metal forming. The application of response surface method (RSM), orthogonal experiment design method (OEDM) and dynamic explicit finite element method (FEM) in the optimum design (OD) for draw bead geometry parameters used in drawing procedure of cross member panel, a benchmark of Numisheet’2005, was discussed. The comparison between the OD results and the draw bead geometry parameters offered by the benchmark was carried. The effectiveness of this method was verified.

keywords.kw: RSM, OEDM, FEM, OD, Drawbead

article_rec.title: The Cause Analysis Model of Pseudo Solder for Chip Component

abstract.par: A cause analysis model of pseudo solder for chip component is presented. Based on analyzing the causes of the chip pseudo solder, an comprehensive equation, which is composed of an ellipse equation and a circle equation, is used to fit the surface shape of chip solder joint. On the basis of that, the chip pseudo solder model is presented. All the parameters of the chip pseudo solder model are effected by the surface mounted technology process, such as solder paste printing process, mounting processing, reflowing process and so on. Experiments results show that the surface shape of the chip solder joint is fit effectively by the comprehensive equation. Experiments results also show that parameters of the chip pseudo solder model can illustrate the cause of pseudo solder effectively.

keywords.kw: pseudo solder, solder joint, PCB, pseudo solder model, surface mounted technology

article_rec.title: The Control System Design of Thermal Experimental Platform for High-Speed Spindle Based PLC

abstract.par: This paper described a control and data collection system about high-speed machine tool spindle simulation load thermal test platform. The system consisted of Electric spindle control module and heat-displacement-force data collection module. PLC as the core of the system combined human-computer interface to realize the running and stopping, frequency setting and overheat protection of spindle, and achieved the lubrication and cooling control, realized the control of spindle release tool shank and blowing air. In the data collection part, the PID adjusting and A/D conversion function of PLC were applied to convert the analog including simulation load force, temperature and displacement to digital which was collected from spindle. The final, the data was displayed in the host computer. The system has been applied successfully in the experiment.

keywords.kw: High-speed spindle thermal test platform, PLC, simulation load, heat-displacement-force

article_rec.title: The Design and Computerized Simulation of High Tooth Contact Ratio of Face Gear Drive with Helical Pinion

abstract.par: A face gear drive with high contact ratio and good dynamic performance are considered. A novel approach is developed for design of high contact ratio based on the path of contact is oriented longitudinally, which can be accomplished by application of profile crowing for helical pinion and face gear tooth surfaces.
